difficulty.title: What is Difficulty?
difficulty.content: Difficulty is a measure of how difficult it is for the miners to solve a block. The higher the difficulty, the harder it is to find a block. Difficulty is measured using SI (Metric International System of Units) prefixes, you can learn more in the following chart:

blocktime.title: What is Block Time?
blocktime.content: Block time refers to the average time it takes for the entire network to mine a new block.

hashrate.title: What is Hashrate?
hashrate.content: Hashrate is a measure of the computational power the network is processing per second. It is calculated using difficulty/blocktime. Hashrate is measured using SI prefixes as well.
